Incar Poyek Infrastruktur, Adhi Karya Siapkan Modal Rp 8 Triliun
07 Nov 2019, 02:51 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) PT Adhi Karya (Persero) Tbk. menyatakan siap terlibat dalam investasi pada proyek-proyek infrastruktur dalam 5 tahun ke depan. Perseroan memperkirakan perlu belanja modal sebesar Rp 7-8 triliun untuk investasi proyek infrastruktur dalam lima tahun ke depan.
Direktur Pengembangan & QHSE PT Adhi Karya Tbk. (ADHI) Partha Sarathi mengatakan bahwa beberapa proyek infrasruktur yang dibidik perseroan antara lain jalan tol, air minum, dan energi. Investasi pada proyek infrastruktur diharapkan memberi dampak pada perolehan kontrak konstruksi.
"Kami tetap fokus di infrastruktur dan capex [capital expenditure] dalam 5 tahun kurang lebih Rp200 triliun. Kami tidak 100 persen, tergantung share-nya. Yang jelas, tujuannya feeding [perolehan kontrak] ke konstruksi," jelas Partha seperti dilansir Bisnis, 7 November 2019.
Investasi pada proyek infrastruktur dinilai masih menjanjikan seiring rencana pemerintah menggenjot proyek-proyek kerja sama dengan badan usaha.
Partha menambahkan, belanja modal untuk investasi proyek infrastruktur bisa diperoleh lewat beragam cara, mulai dari penyertaan modal hingga pinjaman dan penerbitan surat utang. Dia memperkirakan belanja modal yang bakal dirogoh untuk investasi dalam 5 tahun ke depan mencapai kisaran Rp7 triliun—Rp8 triliun.
Menurut Partha, investasi pada proyek-proyek infrastruktur bakal terbuka, terlebih pemerintah bakal memulai pemindahan ibu kota negara ke Kalimantan Timur.
Biaya pemindahan ibu kota negara mencapai Rp486 triliun. Sebanyak Rp265,20 triliun atau 54,60 persen biaya tersebut diharapkan berasal dari kerja sama dengan badan usaha.
Dalam catatan Bisnis, hingga saat ini ADHI sedikitnya terlibat dalam investasi enam proyek senilai Rp95 triliun. Dari enam proyek itu, ada tiga proyek jalan tol yang digarap perseroan bersama mitra dengan penyertaan modal bervariasi. Pada proyek jalan tol Solo—Yogyakarta, Adhi Karya bakal memegang porsi 40 persen, sedangkan di proyek jalan tol Cikunir—Ulujami sebesar 15 persen.
Adhi Karya juga menguasai 3 persen saham di PT Jakarta Tollroad Development, pemegang konsesi 6 ruas tol dalam kota Jakarta. Selain jalan tol, ADHI juga terlibat dalam tiga proyek sistem penyediaan air minum (SPAM). Ketiga proyek tersebut yakni SPAM Karian Timur, SPAM Karian Barat, dan SPAM Dumai. Seluruh proyek ini merupakan prakarsa badan usaha (unsolicited) dan sejauh ini baru SPAM Dumai yang sudah memulai konstruksi.
Partha menuturkan bahwa dalam 3 tahun—4 tahun ke depan, Adhi Karya juga berniat melakukan divestasi sejumlah aset yang sudah mulai memberi keuntungan (brownfield)."Sekarang masih greenfield, belum ada yang bisa divest. Perlu tiga sampai empat tahun lagi."

Targeting Infrastructure, Adhi Karya Prepares Capital of IDR 8 Trillion
Nov 7 2019, 02:51 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs) PT Adhi Karya (Persero) Tbk. expressed readiness to be involved in investment in infrastructure projects in the next 5 years. The company estimates that capital expenditure needs to reach Rp. 7-8 trillion for investment in infrastructure projects in the next five years.
Director of Development & QHSE PT Adhi Karya Tbk. (ADHI) Partha Sarathi said that several infrastructure projects targeted by the company include toll roads, drinking water and energy. Investment in infrastructure projects is expected to have an impact on the acquisition of construction contracts.
"We remain focused on infrastructure and capital expenditure [capex] in 5 years of approximately Rp. 200 trillion. We are not 100 percent, depending on the share. What is clear, the purpose is feeding [obtaining a contract] to construction," explained Partha as reported by Bisnis, 7 November 2019.
Investment in infrastructure projects is still considered promising as the government plans to boost cooperation projects with business entities.
Partha added, capital expenditure for investment in infrastructure projects can be obtained in various ways, ranging from equity investments to loans and issuance of debt securities. He estimates that capital expenditure that will be spent on investment in the next 5 years will reach around Rp7 trillion-Rp8 trillion.
According to Partha, investment in infrastructure projects will be open, especially the government will start moving the country's capital to East Kalimantan.
The cost of moving the national capital reached Rp486 trillion. As much as Rp265.20 trillion or 54.60 percent of the cost is expected to come from cooperation with business entities.
In Bisnis' record, ADHI has at least been involved in investing in six projects worth Rp95 trillion. Of the six projects, there are three toll road projects that the company works with partners with varied capital investments. In the Solo-Yogyakarta toll road project, Adhi Karya will hold a portion of 40 percent, while in the Cikunir-Ulujami toll road project by 15 percent.
Adhi Karya also holds a 3 percent stake in PT Jakarta Tollroad Development, a concession holder of 6 toll roads in the city of Jakarta. Besides toll roads, ADHI is also involved in three water supply system (SPAM) projects. The three projects are SPAM Karian Timur, SPAM Karian Barat, and SPAM Dumai. All of these projects are business initiatives (unsolicited) and so far only the Dumai SPAM has started construction.
Partha said that in the next 3 years - 4 years, Adhi Karya also intends to divest a number of assets that have begun to provide benefits (brownfield). "Now it is still greenfield, no one can be invested. It needs three to four years."
